how does whisper work well the challenge

there
and
you have to somehow deal with that noise
and the solution for radio was developed
by a physicist named joe taylor at
princeton university he won the nobel
prize and is a radio astronomer and a
physicist and what he uses is something
called forward error correction and
other signal processing techniques to
make possible decoding of signals about
negative 31 decibels below the noise
level now for those who aren't engineers
that may sound meaningless but it's
basically what allows you to have
error-free internet communication and a
lot of other sort cell phone
communication the difference is
that your
internet and cell phone communication
still have to have a pretty low noise
level to work whereas what taylor did is
he came up with a system
which by using fairly long blocks of
signals and a number of other signal
processing processing techniques made it
possible to actually decode signals that
are so far below the noise that if you
listen to them on the radio all you hear
is noise there's just absolutely nothing
there as far as you can tell
but by this various types of signal
processing it's able to actually pull
the signal up out of the noise

what he then did is he released his
